New Records: Cameroon have a strong history in the Africa Cup of Nations, winning it five times and having the second-highest number of appearances after Egypt and Ivory Coast.
Cameroon won the 1984 AFCON in Ivory Coast, defeating Nigeria 3-1 in the final.
Key Match Events: Guinea have struggled in the knockout stages of the Africa Cup of Nations, never winning the trophy despite multiple appearances.
Pre-Game Insights: Both Cameroon and Guinea aim to secure maximum points in their first match to progress further in the tournament.
Cameroon's lineup may include Andre Onana, who recently played for Manchester United, adding uncertainty to their starting XI.
Post-Match Reflections: Guinea's qualifier campaign was strong, with Naby Keita scoring twice, indicating potential impact in the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is the third encounter between Cameroon and Guinea at the AFCON, with previous draws in 1998 and 2015.
Others: Cameroon have a high number of appearances in the AFCON, with 21, while Guinea have 14 appearances without a win.
